page.title: 05ROMSLEY COUNTRYSIDE
page.content: We walked to Romsley to start our survey. We used the footpath that went across fields. In many places it was hard to find as farmers often plough the paths up. As we had a large group we sent out scouts to find out where the footpath went. We noticed wheat, barley and oats in the fields. In one field of grass there was an electric fence. This was used to control cattle grazing. On the outskirts of Romsley was a caravan park. We could not go in as you need membership to do this, but we asked some questions of the owner. We found out that many people stay here even though it is not a tourist area. Very often people stay here for one night as Romsley is close to the M5 and people break their journeys here.
